abstract: Standard & Poor’s estimate that Ireland will have to pour 35 billion euros into Anglo Irish Bank looks increasingly realistic and any amount beyond that could trigger rating downgrades, an S&P analyst was quoted on Tuesday as saying, Reuters reported.
snippet: Standard & Poor’s estimate that Ireland will have to pour 35 billion euros into Anglo Irish Bank looks increasingly realistic and any amount beyond that could trigger rating downgrades, an S&P analyst was quoted on Tuesday as saying, Reuters repor...
lead_paragraph: Standard & Poor’s estimate that Ireland will have to pour 35 billion euros ($47 billion) into Anglo Irish Bank looks increasingly realistic and any amount beyond that could trigger rating downgrades, an S.&P. analyst was quoted on Tuesday as saying, Reuters reported.
